title: Historical Face – Extra Heavy Sans Serif
content:
Hi there,

I’m wondering if someone can help me identify the attached font. It’s almost identical to Rian Hughes’ [Wormwood Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108175055/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=DET0000269#specimen), being sold by Veer. However, I’m looking to identify the original face, without the degradation and roughing up that Wormwood has.

I’ve seen it used in a few recent commercial applications, but I recall seeing it most often used in boxing posters from the 1950s and forward.

Any thoughts or suggestions would be appreciated. Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [divergent\_historical.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108175055/http:/typophile.com/files/divergent_historical.gif) | 27.34 KB |

 [‹ (x) Snoop Dogg goth font - Cloister Blackizzle, know what I'm sayin'? {BJ}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108175055/http:/typophile.com/node/7572 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Eurostile-like "Cinema" magazine header - House Gothic 23 {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108175055/http:/typophile.com/node/29056 "Go to next forum topic")
author: design_monkey

comments.content:
Well, not a font, but the files provided here are very close.

[http://withoutwalls.com/html/01pfont.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108175055/http:/withoutwalls.com/html/01pfont.shtml "http://withoutwalls.com/html/01pfont.shtml")

Great suggestions so far. I suppose it’s possible that it’s not a font at all, but is based on old woodtype, as Miss Tiffany suggested.

I’m still holding out for a digital version though!
